subject: Art & Design
title: Biophilic Design: Buildings That Love Nature
description: Learn Biophilic Design: Buildings That Love Nature in one minute.

hook.text: Offices with natural light, plants, and water features reduce sick days by 15%. Buildings affect health.

buildup.text: Biophilic design integrates nature into built environments: daylight, greenery, natural materials, and organic shapes.

discovery.text: Humans evolved in nature. Our brains still respond to natural patterns with reduced stress and improved focus.

twist.text: Singapore's Jewel Changi Airport has a 40-meter indoor waterfall surrounded by a forest.

climax.text: Amazon's Seattle HQ includes giant glass spheres filled with 40,000 plants. Workers meet among trees.

punchline.text: The future of architecture isn't escaping nature. It's inviting it back in.

quiz.question: Why does biophilic design improve occupant well-being?
options: Human brains evolved in nature and respond to natural elements with reduced stress
Plants release chemicals that make people more productive
Natural materials are cheaper than synthetic ones
